title: majorphones
author: majorphones
content: The new version of Major Phones is now available! Check out beta.majorphones.com, your trusted provider of virtual numbers from the United States and the United Kingdom. Our temporary numbers, sourced from leading telephone carriers such as Verizon, Sprint, Vodafone, and T-Mobile, are perfect for verifying accounts on various platforms.Experience the ultimate convenience with Major Phones! Along with hundreds of other options, our service stands out for its incredibly affordable pricing, starting at just $0.3 for US and UK short-term numbers, and $8 for long-term numbers. What's more, we cater to your payment preferences, offering a variety of methods including Perfect Money, Coinbase, Cryptomus, Visa/Mastercard, Amazon Pay, Visa Token, and Zinli. Choose Major Phones for cost-effective, flexible solutions tailored to your needs!Registering is a breeze with Major Phones! Simply supply your name and a valid email for account verification - it's as straightforward as it gets. If you have any questions, our dedicated customer support team is always ready to assist. You can reach out directly by sending a DM to me or by emailing support@majorphones.com. Also, feel free to connect with us on Telegram at @MajorPhones for promptÂ assistance.For a top-up of $10 or more using Payeer, Perfectmoney, or Cryptocurrencies, you will receive two free numbers for receiving SMS!Note: You are eligible for a free copy as long as you are a Jr. Member or more.

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: Amazon Pay enabled now! Accepting Zinli and Visa Token too.

comments.author: btcton
comments.body: What are the ongoing costs for the long-term numbers?

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: Soon we will support voice verification. Please stay alert!

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: Free copies still available? Would love to test the service.

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: Yes, still available. Contact us and let us know your user in the chat.

comments.author: Smedia.Club
comments.body: your post says USD 0.32 but I registered and it says USD 3.2 - 1.4 on the site.Interested in your service for a google voice number for now, possibly whatsapp later on.is the Vouch copy still available?

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: The price depends on the service. Google Voice is expensive because it's in high demand. However, you can find other services with prices under $0.5. Contact us for a free trial!

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: @majorphonesDo you have any plans to extend long-term numbers beyond 30 days?I'm curious to know how our VPN usage interferes with code deliveries [none of the other alternative services that I've tried in the past had this issue].BTW, this thread belongs to the "Service Announcements" board [move topic button is located in the bottom left corner of the page].

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on February 10, 2024, 07:58:57 PM@majorphonesDo you have any plans to extend long-term numbers beyond 30 days?I'm curious to know how our VPN usage interferes with code deliveries [none of the other alternative services that I've tried in the past had this issue].BTW, this thread belongs to the "Service Announcements" board [move topic button is located in the bottom left corner of the page].Hello!Yes, please contact us on Telegram and we can offer you other plans with more days. About VPN usage, a lot of platforms like Google Voice, or PayPal, can detect if you're under VPN/proxy service and they can block your account because the usage of that type of service violates the privacy of those sites. The problem is that a lot of people may associate this with virtual numbers when this is not the case, which is why we explicitly ask you not to use a poor quality VPN/proxy.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: majorphones on February 14, 2024, 12:07:57 PMYes, please contact us on Telegram and we can offer you other plans with more days.Thank you... I'll do it if I ever need one, but I asked that question because I've noticed that some platforms have started forcing SMS-based 2FAs on their users and recently, a few users were looking on this forum for longer-term rentals.Quote from: majorphones on February 14, 2024, 12:07:57 PMAbout VPN usage, a lot of platforms like Google Voice, or PayPal, can detect if you're under VPN/proxy service and they can block your account because the usage of that type of service violates the privacy of those sites. The problem is that a lot of people may associate this with virtual numbers when this is not the case, which is why we explicitly ask you not to use a poor quality VPN/proxy.Perhaps my interpretation of the warning in question wasn't spot-on, so thank you for clarifying that it could still work with a good VPN/proxy.

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on February 14, 2024, 04:22:16 PMQuote from: majorphones on February 14, 2024, 12:07:57 PMYes, please contact us on Telegram and we can offer you other plans with more days.Thank you... I'll do it if I ever need one, but I asked that question because I've noticed that some platforms have started forcing SMS-based 2FAs on their users and recently, a few users were looking on this forum for longer-term rentals.Quote from: majorphones on February 14, 2024, 12:07:57 PMAbout VPN usage, a lot of platforms like Google Voice, or PayPal, can detect if you're under VPN/proxy service and they can block your account because the usage of that type of service violates the privacy of those sites. The problem is that a lot of people may associate this with virtual numbers when this is not the case, which is why we explicitly ask you not to use a poor quality VPN/proxy.Perhaps my interpretation of the warning in question wasn't spot-on, so thank you for clarifying that it could still work with a good VPN/proxy.Perfect. Yes, we offer long-term numbers of USA/UK. Soon we will enabled a new feature oriented to reuse the same number without the need to have a long-term

comments.author: majorphones
comments.body: New countries added. Australia, Japan, China, Spain, France, Mexico and more... Visit us for more information.
